It sounds like you had a thorough and immersive experience with The Last of Us Part II.

It's great that you have a clear idea of how you want to approach your review. Focusing on the emotional resonance and character motivations will allow you to share your personal connection with the game without revealing too much about the story.

When writing your review, be sure to include specific details about your experience, such as:

* How the game made you feel, and what emotions it evoked
* What you thought about the characters' motivations and actions
* Any memorable moments or scenes that stood out to you
* How the game's themes resonated with you, and what you think they add to the narrative

Using vague language to avoid spoilers can be a bit tricky, but it's definitely doable. Remember to focus on the emotions and tone, rather than specific plot points. You can also use phrases like "a pivotal moment," "a haunting scene," or "a emotional encounter" to convey the impact of the game without giving away too much.

If you need any more guidance or have any questions, feel free to ask. I'm here to help!

Also, don't forget to include some details about your playtime and experience with the game, such as the dates you played it and the amount of time you spent on side quests and exploration. This can help give readers a sense of the game's scope and depth.

Good luck with your review, and I hope it turns out to be a great piece that does justice to your experience with The Last of Us Part II!
